s.text: I've tried to do the same in writing about the place, for while I think Celebration is a flawed experiment with insidious implications, I also think that Disney was adventurous to try it, and that the architects and planners Disney employed to make it a reality are in thrall to a worthy ideal.

I've tried to do the same in writing about the place, for while I think Celebration is a flawed experiment with insidious implications, I also think that Disney was adventurous to try it, and that the architects and planners Disney employed to make it a reality are in thrall to a worthy ideal.
Now, the same for books: I give just about anyone high marks for writing one, and I hate to see any author misread cavalierly, as so regularly happens.
It takes the same year, same town, same questions, and many of the same events, and hunts for their meaning in a very different direction.
